title: Kraken/Strategies

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Kraken is a Slayer boss and can therefore only be killed while on a Slayer task to kill (cave) kraken. The Kraken is located in the Kraken Cove.

content:
A player battles the Kraken after disturbing its slumber.

The Kraken is a Slayer boss and can therefore only be killed while on a Slayer task to kill (cave) kraken. The Kraken is located in the Kraken Cove.

It is recommended to use the Magic attack style to fight the Kraken, as it is highly resistant to Ranged and immune to Melee, due to the fact that it cannot be reached by Melee attacks. As there are no complex mechanics when facing this boss, the Kraken is a popular boss. Therefore it may be hard to find an empty world. Players can alternatively create an instance for 25,000 coins, which lasts until the player leaves or logs out.

Contents

  • 1 Requirements
    • 1.1 Recommendations
  • 2 Getting there
  • 3 Mechanics
    • 3.1 Releasing the Kraken
    • 3.2 Attack styles
  • 4 Tips
    • 4.1 Instance
    • 4.2 Prayer
  • 5 Equipment
    • 5.1 Magic

Requirements[edit | edit source]

  • Level 87 to deal damage against the Kraken.

Recommendations[edit | edit source]

  • High combat stats. Although not required, see the skill levels below for an indication of the advised stats:
    • If using Magic:
      • Level 75 or higher to equip the correct staves.
  • Partial completion of Fairytale II - Cure a Queen for access to the fairy rings network.
  • Bracelet of Slaughter to extend trip length.

Getting there[edit | edit source]

The Kraken is located in a separated section of the Kraken Cove. The quickest way to get to this dungeon is via fairy rings:

  • Use the code AKQ, then run west to the dungeon entrance.

Run north after entering the Kraken cove to find the entrance to the Kraken's lair.

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

Releasing the Kraken[edit | edit source]

Without a fishing explosive, players must disturb the four smaller whirlpools before they can successfully release the Kraken.

To disturb the Kraken and start the fight, the player must use a fishing explosive on the large whirlpool, or attack the four small whirlpools and then attack the large whirlpool.

When using explosives, the impact audio cue indicates the Kraken is active, and attacks will register even if it has not emerged visually; any attacks made before the cue will produce no response.

The smaller whirlpools will change into four Enormous Tentacles, while the central whirlpool will change into the Kraken itself.

Attack styles[edit | edit source]

During the fight, the player will be attacked by four Enormous Tentacles and by the Kraken itself:

  • The Kraken only attacks with a typeless magical ranged attack:
    • 'Typeless' means that protection prayers will not have any effect.
    • 'Magical ranged' means that the attack accuracy is decided by the ranged attack bonuses of the Kraken and the magic defence bonuses of the player.
    • The max hit of this attack is 28.
    • The attack isn't very accurate and has an attack speed of 4 (i.e. every 2.4 seconds).
  • The Enormous Tentacles only attack with a typeless magical ranged attack:
    • 'Typeless' means that protection prayers will not have any effect.
    • 'Magical ranged' means that the attack accuracy is decided by the ranged attack bonuses of the Enormous Tentacles and the magic defence bonuses of the player.
    • The max hit of this attack is 2.
    • The attack is very accurate and has an attack speed of 4 (i.e. every 2.4 seconds).

Tips[edit | edit source]

Instance[edit | edit source]

The Kraken is a popular boss, therefore it may be hard to find an empty world. To combat this, players can create a private instance for 25,000 coins.

An advantage of a private instance is that dropped items stay on the ground for a longer period of time. Normally, items disappear after two minutes upon being dropped and other players can see it after one minute. However, this is not an issue if instancing, as dropped items disappear in 30 minutes within the Kraken Cove instance. As the Kraken regularly drops a generous amount of food in the form of 5 edible seaweed or 5 sharks, the instance makes it a lot easier on the player to juggle these food sources before they disappear.

It is highly recommend to turn Auto Retaliate off when fighting the Kraken, as the tentacles continue to attack the player after it has been killed, resulting in wasted runes or weapon charges should your character attack them in return.

When exiting the instance, either by leaving, dying, or logging out, all items on the ground will be permanently lost. If a player dies, all items carried will be moved to a gravestone outside the instance.

Prayer[edit | edit source]

As the Kraken and its tentacles use typeless attacks, the protection prayers have no effect. Players that bring an imbued heart should pray Preserve. Players with low Magic and/or Defence may consider praying Augury or Mystic Might to increase their magical defence.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

Magic[edit | edit source]

This is the best-in-slot available equipment for maging the Kraken. The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 1,072,542,272 coins. See the table below for an overview of equipment alternatives in case this setup is not accessible or too expensive.

Notes[edit | edit source]

  • Casting fire spells with a charged tome of fire equipped will increase the spell's damage by 50%.
  • The occult necklace (+10%), tormented bracelet (+5%), imbued god capes (+2%) and ancestral robes (+2% each) increase the maximum hit of the player's Magic spells.
  • Rune pouch to hold rune drops.
  • The Imbued heart will increase your damage and reduce the damage you take considerably.
  • 1-2 Prayer potions or Super restores for using the Preserve prayer to keep imbued heart stats up.
  • Dramen staff for fairy ring akq, if elite Lumbridge diary is not completed.
  • Instead of a Dramen staff, a Piscatoris teleport puts you near the kraken cave whilst saving an inventory slot. However Home Teleport will need to be used to leave.
  • Explorer's ring 4 for high alchemy if not bringing runes.
  • Eldritch nightmare staff's special attack will restore your prayer, allowing you to keep Augury and Preserve on for the imbued heart boost to maintain high magic defence.
  • The Toxic blowpipe offers a much cheaper option for those who do not want to spend money on the Eldritch/Volatile nightmare staffs. One may consider using its special attack on the Enormous Tentacles, as they have a slightly lower +270 ranged defence bonus compared to the Kraken's +300. However, although the Kraken takes heavily reduced ranged damage, the blowpipe special attack will still grant the full health replenishment. Despite having a +270 (or +300 for Kraken) ranged defence bonus, you will still hit often because the Kraken and its tentacles have a level one base defence level. This is especially useful when wearing Karils or Armadyl armour.
  • The Volatile nightmare staff is a good special attack option if you're looking to farm Kraken as fast as possible.
  • The Elysian spirit shield does not work against the Kraken's attacks, as they're typeless and are able to hit through prayer. However, the passive effect greatly reduces damage taken from Kraken’s tentacles.[1]
